intro: Sprengelia brachyanthera, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by yellow disk flowers, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and forest edges. Sprengelia brachyanthera is known for its ability to thrive in wet conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
